column2: Provides requirements and guidelines for performing life-cycle cost (LCC) analyses of buildings and constructed assets and their parts, whether new or existing.
column3: 1) To predict and assess the cost performance of constructed assets.
column5:
-ISO 14044:2006 and ISO 14040:2006 (for the parts relevant Goal, Scope, inventory)

-SETAC Guideline: Environmental Life cycle Costing: A code of Practice, 2011

-ISO 15686-5:2008: Buildings and constructed assets. Service life planning. Life cycle costing
column7: Procurers of constructed assets, designers, constructors and suppliers, facility operators, cost consultants
column8: Achieves better value for money from the buildings and constructed assets we procure and use and compares different scenarios as: no-action scenario, retrofitting scenario, innovative scenario.
column11:
The application involves 4 main phases: 
- Goal and scope
- Inventory analysis
- Impact assessment
- Interpretation
